description: The place is very cozy and nice. They play great music in the background. But most of all the food is amazingly good and the staff is super nice. Best place to eat in the area and you spend only 10$
author: Guy S.

description: Authentic filipino breakfast. Excellent service, friendly and fast.  Definitely will visit again when in SF
author: Teri m.

description: So so hap to see a pilipin restaurant serb dish prom my child and add egg (tselog) to ebryting. Also, der coco pie is berr yum.
author: Anna V.

description: They have some great food here but the Tocino had quite a bit of fat on it. Otherwise, service was speedy and the food tasted great. Customer service was also pretty good!
author: Jed R.

description: hole in the wall feel with amazing food and super helpful cook/servers.
author: Steve F.

description: Excellent take out food. Different type of Asian flavors. We had beef tapsilog, chicken sisigsilog, and palabok noodles.
author: Charles C.

description: Amazing food, amazing service. I got the chicken sisig and my boyfriend got the longanisa. This place is a gem and we will definitely return during our next trip to the city!
author: Kaitlyn M.

description: My go to spot when im partying in the city and im craving filipino food late night...the sisig is a must...i dont think ive tried anything else, or at least i dont remember..dont remember a time where theyve diappointed my appetite...then again, i dont really remember eating here..im always drunk..
author: Jessie V.

description: Fried chicken is delectable. Loved that it was juicy and slightly spicy. The garlic rice with a sunny-side egg was perfect. I've been in San Fran for 4 days and this is the best meal I've had. Not to take away from anywhere else...but this place is just that good! Much love from Milwaukee.
author: Casey R.

description: Really good and authentic Filipino food! everything was on point! I would recommend the sisigsilog, lechon kawali silog (altho this was a special, I'm not sure if it's available everyday; worth a try to ask tho!!) If you're feeling under the weather, order the arroz caldo for a good cold weather fix. The severs were amazingly accommodating too! Garlic rice ftw!
author: Anna R.

description: Everything is good, but for your first time I'd get the sisigsilog, it's tasty, filling, and fairly cheap. This place has all the classic Filipino dishes and even has that purple cake for dessert. It's located in not the best area, but that shouldn't deter you from getting some good food at a decent price.
author: Jon M.

description: I had the pancit noodles and beef stew over garlic rice and it was delicious. The beef stew had savory and had strong star anise which I love.
author: N A.

description: I been ordering Tselogs here since they open, every time we order dinner always messing our food, first the food it's always cold looks like been cook all day , tonight we order Bangsilog , they gave me a tiny little fish and really dry can't barely bite it, rice & eggs looks was bad . Longanisa looks been cook this morning also ....no more Tselog, way too expensive for cold & tiny food....2 order for  $21.39
author: Mary V.

description: Been once for lunch, and its a good deal for basic comfort food, well made. Calling it a hole in the wall doesn't do it justice - it is small, with maybe a dozen counter seats, but clean and welcoming. I had the fried chicken, and my friend had beef -  both came with garlic rice and the ubiquitous fried egg. Chicken was damn good - I added a lot of Sirracha sauce as I like it spicy. My friend like her beef, but said it was a touch on the bitter side. Coconut pie with ice cream was great for dessert. Just on the edge of the Tenderloin, so no issues there. Nice staff - our waitress was friendly, helpful, busy and hot.
author: Doug L.

description: Small. Took a while for me to get a seat, to get my meal. After the cooking took forever, I saw it sitting in the counter because the cashier was helping others people. Grr food is good but very salty. Had to eat my palabok with white rice.
author: Karina H.

description: Pretty decent food at a reasonable price. Get the extra chicken soup for $1. Yes, that's not a typo. Small place and can get a little crowded.
author: Andrew Y.

description: First time eating Filipino food and i was not disappointed!  We had the sisitsilog, lumpia (egg rolls), adobo, and use macopuno pie.  The adobo wasn't on the menu but my Filipino friend recommende it and its definitely worth trying.  Enjoyed the food and it was a cool little atmosphere.  Not a big place however so might get full during busy periods.
author: Jeff N.

description: They should update their website. It said open till 9pm but when we went there before 7pm today it was already closed. That killed my excitement. So disappointing!
author: Jay Q.

description: Absolutely love! This place is lovely, simple but great food! Quick and nice service.
author: Huan X.

description: Amazing food for a good price. They got a little busy with to go orders and walk ins but it's clearly because the great food. Service was very friendly
author: Jeff G.

description: Delicious, would recommend. I always get the sisig silog. Lumpia and spaghetti are the next favorites!
author: Sophie N.

description: Good, simple, authentic Filipino comfort food at an affordable price.The seating area inside is tiny, so plan accordingly (and don't be that guy who orders for a party of 16 without calling in first)! The staff is friendly, and the food is prepared quickly. It's my go-to for a fast hot meal when I'm in the area.
author: DS K.

description: Tasty and cheap! Staff was very nice. Would definitely come back to grab a bite when in the neighborhood.
author: Cole G.

description: Great new little restaurant. Went with the chicken sisig-sizzling. Delicious. Looking forward to coming back - Good food and good price.
author: Chris G.
